author: markekraus
body:
closes #4875 

Sorting, separating and labeling the file overrides and words, and fixing incorrect `CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md` override.

comments.body:

comments.author: daxian-dbw
comments.body:
@markekraus Thanks!
@TravisEz13 will be very pleased to see this PR 😄

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @daxian-dbw me too I've had the displeasure of updating this file quite a bit lately. 😆

comments.author: TravisEz13
comments.body: It might be good to add a test or a tool that will keep it sorted.

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body:
Hmm https://travis-ci.org/PowerShell/PowerShell/jobs/277989665
This output is all over the place. I can't tell if it is a temporary glitch or something is actually broken.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus that's intentional via https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/pull/4855.  Failed tests will still show up verbatim, but passed/skipped/pending tests are just a symbol.  Some output (longer than console width) still sneaks through due to https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/issues/4172

comments.author: markekraus
comments.body: @SteveL-MSFT [This particular one is odd](https://travis-ci.org/PowerShell/PowerShell/jobs/277989665). It looks like the test ran 3 times or were at least outputed 3 times. The macOS and AppVeyor build look normal (well, post-terse normal anyway) but the Trusty build is odd.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @markekraus you're right, didn't notice that.  In that run, the output implies the tests ran twice.  Looked at another CI run to compare and it didn't have that problem.  Need to keep an eye out to see if that was a one-off or something else.

title: Sort .spelling
